edge_media_to_caption:
Reflection perfection at Hintersee in Bavaria.
‚Äî-
In the far south of Bavaria is a place called Berchtesgaden. It is probably one of the most beautiful places we have ever visited.
Nestled in the Alps, it offers stunning view after stunning view.
This morning was perfect.
No wind and a beautiful sunrise.
‚Äî‚Äî
Sony A7RIII
16mm
F/11 
3 seconds 
ND 9 soft grad and polarizer filters.
‚Äî-
#visitbavaria #germanytourism #germanyüá©üá™

The hourglass shape of Lake Eibsee in Bavaria, Germany.
‚Äî-
Lake Eibsee is one place you cannot miss when you visit Bavaria.
Not only is it a beautiful backdrop for Germany‚Äôs highest peak but the colours from above are just stunning.
‚Äî-
You can hike around the lake and get so many different views. There is something jaw dropping around every corner.
‚Äî-
One tip I would suggest is to get there early for the best light. When the lift hits the mountains you feel like you are in a dream.
‚Äî‚Äî
#visitbavaria #germanytourism #germanyüá©üá™

Hiking in the Bavarian Alps!
‚Äî‚Äî
It's that time of year again to get out and explore. ‚Äî‚Äî
Travel often inspires us to try new adventures and hobbies, but it's important to make sure we are protected as we head into the summer travel season. 
We've teamed up with @medjetassist to remind everyone about the importance of medical evacuation coverage. 
We have it, and we don't travel without it. Accidents can happen anytime, anywhere. 
You don't have to be climbing a mountain to have an unexpected emergency, but it helps to know that even if you are doing something extreme, and land yourself in the hospital, Medjet is there to get you medically transferred to your own hospital at home (regardless of medical necessity, which is an important differentiator from insurance). We learned all this THE HARD WAY‚Ä¶when Dave broke his back in the Amazon‚Ä¶  Find out more in the link in our bio.

Morning light on Neuschwanstein Castle in Bavaria, Germany.
‚Äî-
We got up super early to drive from Munich to Neuschwanstein and were rewarded with several beautiful views of this castle.
‚Äî-
The first was from Marienbruke where we had the usually busy bridge all to ourselves.
The second was this stunning view from a little further away.
‚Äî-
If I had one tip it would be to be there for around sunrise. The peacefulness of the castle and its surroundings is worth the early wake up call. (At this time of year it is about 4am).
‚Äî-
What I love about this photo is that you get the true view of how much land King Ludwig II ruled over.
‚Äî-
#germanytourism #visitbavaria #germany #castles

Sunset at Dunguaire Castle in Ireland.
‚Äî
As we were driving along the Wild Atlantic Way we came across this castle.
The sun was low and a lone swan was floating out front.
It seemed like the perfect scene.
‚Äî‚Äî
Where have stumbled across an amazing scene?
‚Äî‚Äî
#wildatlanticway #ireland #irelandtravel

The beautiful reflections of Suzhou at night.
‚Äî‚Äî
Suzhou really surprised me. Not only is it full of beautiful gardens but the way the old town lights up at night is just spectacular.
‚Äî‚Äî
The colours are mesmerizing and when you combine that with the excitement of the people, public Karaoke and the water that flows through the city you have a unique experience.
‚Äî‚Äî
Make sure to check out our stories for the wide version of this scene.
‚Äî‚Äî
Sony A7RIII
Sony 16-35 F/4
30 seconds
6 stop ND filter.
‚Äî‚Äî
#suzhou #travelsuzhou #sonyartisan #sonyalpha

The beauty of the Humble Administrators Garden in Suzhou, China.
‚Äî‚Äî
Suzhou is well known for its beautiful gardens and this one was one of the most stunning.
Filled with rocks, ponds, flowers and beautiful architecture I can see why people travel from miles around to visit these gardens.
The peace and tranquility was a stark contrast to the hustle and bustle of Shanghai.
If you are visiting Shanghai I highly recommend a trip out to Suzhou.
We loved it here and would definitely come back.
‚Äî‚Äî
#travelsuzhou #suzhou #humbleadministratorsgarden

Beautiful reflections at Nioushu Mountain in Nanjing, China.

When we were heading to this mountain I was not expecting this. The Usnisa Palace is probably one the most unique places I have ever seen. 
This space age building houses a huge reclining Buddah and a collection of thousands of small buddahs that will blow your mind.

This place is definitely worth a visit if you are in Nanjing and make sure to bring your camera.
-----
Shot on my @huaweimobilecan
 P30 Pro
#gotonanjing #nanjing #nanjingchina #china

Into the Abyss at the Jin Mao Tower in Shanghai.
----
The Jin Mao Tower is the third highest tower in Shanghai and the only one that offers 360 degree views 
While the skyline views are awesome, it was the incredible view down the center of the tower from the 88th floor.
it looks like something out of a science fiction movie.
If you ever get to Shanghai, don't miss this.
Shot on my Huawei P30 Pro.
----
#shanghai #shanghailife_ #jinmaotower #architecturephotography #rewritetherules

Some Koala cuteness from South Australia.
‚Äî-
One of the things I loved most about our time in South Australia was gett to see Koala Bears up close.
They just have the most animated faces and cool personalities.
They don‚Äôt move very much or very fast, so they are easy to photograph.
‚Äî-
Have you seen a Koala Bear in the wild?
‚Äî‚Äî
#seeaustralia #southaustralia #koalabear #koalas

The Old man of Storr stands guard on the Isle of Skye.
-------
You have to visit the Isle of Skye if you head to the Highlands of Scotland.  And you must visit the Old Mann of Storr while you are there. 
Many of the photos I see are from the climb up but there is a great view as you approach that gives you this particular view.

It really sums up the beauty of the Isle of Skye. ‚Äî‚Äî
If you are around Toronto this weekend make sure and drop by to Henry‚Äôs on Church Street where I will be giving a workshop on travel photography for @sonycanada at Sony Days!
Drop by and say hi! I am on at 3pm. It is free and the link is in my bio!
Hope to see you there!
‚Äî‚Äî
#lovegreatbritain #sonyalpha #sonyartisan #visitscotland #isleofskye

The beautiful Tiger‚Äôs Nest Monastery is part of my first Gallery event this Friday.
‚Äî‚Äî
If you are in Toronto this weekend or anytime throughout April 26-May 26 make sure to drop in and check out my first Gallery showing at @levelfineart. ‚Äî-
I have printed 15 of my favourite photos on a mix of Metal and Acrylic. They are large prints, with sizes up to 45x80 and they look incredible.
‚Äî-
Keep an eye on our stories this week for more info. If you want to come to the event it is free and we will be giving away a beautiful Metal Print and a photobook!
Hope to see you there!
The link to the event is in our bio!
‚Äî‚Äî
#bhutan #tigersnest #paro #fineartphotography

Stormy skies over Peles Castle in Romania.
‚Äî‚Äî
After watching Game of Thrones last night and seeing all those castles I just had to post this photo.
With mountains in the background and the looming weather I thought this fit with the GOT theme.
‚Äî-
Peles Castle is a place you have to visit if you travel to Romania. Built in 1873 it really captures the whole Gothic Revival architecture.
‚Äî-
Today‚Äôs Question: Do you watch the Game of Thrones?
‚Äî‚Äî
#romania #djimavicpro

Dramatic skies over the Grand Canyon.
‚Äî‚Äî
Watching the weather roll in over this landscape was incredible. It seemed like the view was endless.

It is like all the elements are coming together in one photo. The sun, the clouds, the weather and of course the canyon.
‚Äî‚Äî
Today‚Äôs Question: Where have you seen the best display of Mother Nature?
‚Äî‚Äî
#grandcanyon #arizona #sunset #weather

Colours change on the road to Hopewell Rocks in New Brunswick, Canada.
‚Äî
There is nothing like the the open road. Especially during the changing of the seasons. I know we are transitioning into spring but I just had to share this image taken last fall in NB.
‚Äî
One of the things I love about having the drone is getting different perspectives like this. ‚Äî-
Today‚Äôs Question: where have you seen the most beautiful fall colours?
‚Äî-
#canada #imagesofcanada #newbrunswick #djimavicpro2

Magical skies in the Cayman Islands.
‚Äî-
The Cayman Islands was by far one of our favourite islands of all time. The people are amazing, the food to die for and the sunsets weren‚Äôt too bad either üòä.
‚Äî-
With it being so close to the mainland I can see why so many expats choose to live here.
‚Äî-
Today‚Äôs Question: what destination do you think you could live in?
‚Äî-
#caymanislands #cayman #camanabay

Old cars line the streets in Havana, Cuba.
‚Äî-
One of the main reasons I wanted to go to Cuba was to see all the cool old cars.
Well I wasn‚Äôt disappointed. While walking around Old Cuba it felt like stepping back in time. 
Luckily we were staying at the @iberostargrandpackard which put us in a great location.
‚Äî-
This particular shot was just inside Chinatown. It really embodies the whole essence of Cuba in one shot.
‚Äî-
#iberostargrandpackard #havana #cuba

Just hangin‚Äô on the beach with my friends!
‚Äî
South Africa is definitely one of our favourite countries in the world. 
The landscapes are epic and the wildlife seems like it is everywhere.
‚Äî
I really had to reach back into the vault for this shot. It was taken just after we cycled 12,000 km from Cairo to Cape Town and we were enjoying a little R&R afterwards.
‚Äî
We rented a car and headed to Simonstown, where we heard there were penguins.
‚Äî
Penguins in South Africa? Right!
‚Äî
Sure enough there they were. And these four just hung out and posed for us for like 10 minutes!
‚Äî
What destination has surprised you the most??
‚Äî
#simonstown #simonstownsouthafrica #southafrica #penguins #bouldersbeach

Sunset at Morrow Castle in Havana, Cuba.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Just down from the @iberostargrandpackard where we were staying was the Malecon. This offered us a spectacular view of the bay and this castle.

Built in 1589, this castle protects the entrance to Havana Bay. The lighthouse was added in 1846 and the walls are really well preserved.

This view is taken from the Malecon, where locals gather each evening to stroll, fish and enjoy the warm sea breezes.

Havana is one of those places that we really loved. A perfect blend of culture, architecture and friendly people.
This is one place we know we will return to.
‚Äî‚Äî
Today‚Äôs Question: What destination would you return to again and again?
‚Äî‚Äî-
#iberostargrandpackard #malecon #havana

Morning light over the incredible landscape of Cappadocia, Turkey.
‚Äî‚Äî
I will never forget that morning. As we shivered getting in the ballon before dawn , I was wondering if this was going to live up to the hype.

Well, I am happy to report that it did. We have been fortunate to see a lot of amazing things in our travels but there is nothing like floating silently over the mystical landscape of Cappadocia in a hot air ballon.

When the sun peaks over the horizon and light the ground below you realize just how amazing this planet is.

We loved it so much we did it twice. This is something you have to do if you are ever in Turkey. It will be unforgettable!
‚Äî‚Äî
#cappadocia #turkey #hotairballoon

Looking over the 12 Apostles in Australia.
‚Äî-
When we were in Australia we had the chance to do a walk to the 12 Apostles. This was the perfect way to see these magnificent creations.

This particular shot was taken from a helicopter. Something I really recommend doing if you travel there.

It gives you a whole new appreciation for the rugged coastline of Australia.
‚Äî-
#seeaustralia #12apostles #australia

Sunset at the crossroads.
‚Äî-
Looking down from the top of the Westin hotel gives you a birdseye view of this beautiful city. 
I find that Ottawa comes alive at night and this shot really captures the excitement as the sun goes down.

Ottawa is one of those cities that surprises you. With a great food scene, the worlds largest naturally frozen ice rink, and so many sites to see, Ottawa is a great year round destination.

What destination surprised you the most? ‚Äî‚Äî
#myottawa #explorepage #explorecanada #discoverontario

Taking in the architectural marvel that is Notre Dame Cathedral.
‚Äî‚Äî
It is funny that out of all of the times that we have been to Ottawa we never visited the inside of Notre Dame.

Well this time we remedied that and were happy that we did. It is just beautiful!

Built in 1846 in the neo-gothic style it really takes your breath away when you walk in.

What structure has blown your mind on your travels? ‚Äî‚Äî #myottawa #explorecanada #notredame #ontario

The beautiful gaze of the Arctic Fox.
‚Äî-
When we were up in the Arctic we saw a few of these guys but they were always so fast and a little too far away to grab a great shot of.

So, when we had the chance to visit @parcomega we jumped at the chance.

This place is amazing! We spent almost a full day here. The park consists of over 2000 acres and houses some pretty cool animals.

This is not a zoo. It is a place where the animals are given space to roam and live.

If you get a chance to visit make sure you take it! ‚Äî‚Äî #parcomega #arcticfox #wildlifephotography #myottawa

Reflection perfection in Northern Canada.
‚Äî‚Äî
You know those sunsets when you just know they are going to be amazing? This was one of those days.

We had been hiking one of Canada‚Äôs most challenging trails, The Pukaskwa, this was the reward that night.
When the wind is non existent and the air is thick with humidity, you ignore the mosquitoes and take in this beautiful scene.
Mother Nature has a way of putting a smile on your face.

Where have you seen the most amazing sunset? ‚Äî‚Äî
#discoveron #discoverontario #explorepage #explorecanada #parkscanada #sunset

Sunrise at the...Nudgee Tree in Brisbane, Australia
‚Äî-
If there were any mountains in the backgeound I am sure some people would think this is the Wanaka Tree.

But, This tree is actually in Brisbane, Australia. We headed out here for an early morning shoot and we‚Äôre not disappointed. 
It was high tide and the light was perfect! I love discovering little hidden gems when I go to a place.

What is you number one hidden gem? ‚Äî‚Äî
#brisbane #seeaustralia #brisbanecity #queensland

The perfect day on the island of Capri, Italy.
‚Äî-
I love just driving and discovering cool places. Our time in Italy was all about that.

This particular day we saw a small one way road off of a parking lot and decided to see where it went. We drove for a little bit the walked about 5 minutes and it opened up to this view! Amazing!

Italy has always been one of our favourite countries!

What is your favourite country? ‚Äî‚Äî
#italy #amalficoast #capri

Morning light at Lake Annette in Jasper, Alberta.
‚Äî-
Jasper is really one of those places you have to visit if you are in Alberta. 
Most people combine Jasper and Banff in one trip. What a great idea!

Both really show off the beauty of the Rocky Mountains. This was taken just down the road from where we were staying. It was one of those mornings that were still and quiet.

That is one of the things I love about morning in the mountains...the stillness.
‚Äî-
What do you prefer? Mountains or Beaches?
‚Äî‚Äî
#travelalberta #explorepage #explorecanada #jaspernationalpark

Ice climbing in the Alberta Rockies.
‚Äî-
Our first stab at ice climbing was in Canmore, Alberta. It was about -20 outside and the ice was pretty brittle.

Luckily we had a great instructor and we were able to make it too the top without freezing to death. 
It always amazes me how you can learn a lot faster when it is that cold outside.

What is your favourite winter activity? ‚Äî- #travelalberta #explorecanada

What is your favourite festival in the world?
‚Äî
As Festival season starts soon in many countries around the world we wanted to see what has been your favourite.

We have been to quite a few around the world but the Lantern Festival in Chiang Mai, Thailand is definitely one of the most beautiful.

Every year they light 100s of thousands of paper lanterns and release them into the sky. It is definitely something to witness.

Share your experiences in the comments!

#thailand #thailandtravel

Where is the most off the beaten path destination you have travelled to?
‚Äî‚Äî
This is Illulissat Icefjord in Greenland. It is a UNESCO world heritage site and is definitely one of the most off the beaten path destinations we have travelled to.

This particular day it was raining and I was glad to have the wooden path that made its way through the tundra. 
I will never forget the beauty and ruggedness of this place which some have deemed the ‚ÄúBirthplace of Icebergs‚Äù

Share your story in the comments! ‚Äî‚Äî
#greenland #arctic #remote

Star gazing in the Maldives is amazing!
‚Äî‚Äî
The Maldives is a great destination for many reasons but most people overlook the amazing skies at night.

Being out in the middle of the ocean and away from any light pollution allows you to witness the beauty of the stars in all of their splendour.

It is just one of many moments we won‚Äôt forget in the Maldives.

today‚Äôs Question: where have you seen the darkest skies? ‚Äî‚Äî
#maldives #maldivesislands #milkyway

First image of 2019! Sunrise at the Shinkyo Bridge in Nikko, Japan.
‚Äî‚Äî
As we cross the bridge into the new year I thought this would be an appropriate image.

Even though 2018 was a great year, thank to all of you, we are looking forward to an even better one in 2019.
We hav a lot of great travels coming up and we can‚Äôt wait to share them with you.

Thanks again for all. Of your support over the years! You guys are awesome!

Today‚Äôs Question: Where are you planning to travel in 2019?
Leave your answer in the comments!
‚Äî‚Äî
#japan #nikko #sonya7riii #tobujapantrip

Our Top Photos of 2018 #2: Sunrise at the famous Bixby Bridge in Big Sur, California.
‚Äî‚Äî
We had so much fun in California this year. But by far my favourite part of the state is the drive along Big Sur.

The scenery is just stunning at every turn. This particular bridge is a popular stop during the day. But if you visit early in the morning you have it all to yourself.

I will never forget that morning as the sun came up and lit the clouds. It was magical.
‚Äî‚Äî
What do you prefer, sunrise or sunset?
‚Äî‚Äî
#catchthewinterwave #visitcalifornia #seemonterey

Our Top Photos is 2018 #3: Stormy skies roll in over Peles Castle in Romania.
-------
We had so much fun in Romania. We visited castles, hung out with locals and experienced the historic cities. 
This country surprised us at every turn.

I remember this location in particular. 
Not long after this shot we got drenched. I just got the drone down and packed it away before the skies opened up. I do think this Castle looks great at any time of day in any weather. -------
Is Romania on your bucket list?
‚Äî‚Äî
Shot on my @djiglobal #mavicpro -------
#romania #castles

Out Top Images of 2018 #4: The Taj Mahal at sunrise.
‚Äî‚Äî
The Taj Mahal is probably on everyone‚Äôs bucket list. When we visited we lined up early, ran ahead of he crowd and managed to get quite a few images with no people in them.

This is not the classic view of he Taj but I still love how the doorway frames the Taj Mahal.

What do you think? Do you like the classic view better?

Let us know in the comments. We will be counting down our favourites if 2018 this weekend.

#tajmahal #india

Frozen waterfalls at Johnston Canyon, Alberta.
‚Äî‚Äî
It is that time of year again for frozen waterfalls. I love visiting these places in both summer and winter. Each season gives them a different look.

I remember it was about -25 when we were out photographing this. But man was it worth it!

Which season do you like better, winter or summer?

#travelalberta #banffnationalpark #explorecanada

The Torii Gates Tunnel at the Hie Shrine Akasaka in Tokyo, Japan.
‚Äî‚Äî
If you are looking for an alternative to the torii gates in Kyoto(or just haven‚Äôt got here yet) this is a great alternative.
Located in The Hie Shrine, these are kind of hidden at he south entrance. 
But is well worth seeking out if you are in Tokyo. Try and get there in the early morning as the light is best and the crowds are few.

What is the best hidden gem you have discovered on your travels? 
Let us know in the comments. We are always looking for new places to discover.

Ready for the harvest outside of Yangzhou, China.
‚Äî‚Äî
Exploring the rural areas of China was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. 
Just jumping on a bicycle and going led to us meeting some great people and finding some incredible scenes.

It was like stepping back in time.
Farmers plough their fields with oxen and ancient ploughs and women waved and smiled as we cycled by.

If you like getting off he beaten path this is the place for you.

Today‚Äôs question: Where have you had your best ‚Äúoff the beaten path‚Äù experience?

Join the conversation in the comments below.

A sunset view of Sigiriya in Sri Lanka.
‚Äî‚Äî
We climbed up to the top of Pidurangala in order to get this view. It was a sweaty climb but well worth it.
We had climbed Sigiriya on a previous trip but really wanted to get a shot of the rock itself.

This definitely afforded us the best view.

This photo is the inspiration for today‚Äôs question...
Where have you had the best sunset view? 
Was it from the top of a mountain? On a beach?

We want to make our Instagram more of a conversation, so feel free to leave you answer to the question and interact with others.
Inspire each other with you answers.
‚Äî‚Äî
#bealpha #sonyalpha

Maui‚Äôs Bamboo Forest.
‚Äî‚Äî
What destination surprised you the most? ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Did you know that Maui has a massive bamboo forest? 
We had no idea until we drove the Hana Highway and hiked the Pipiwai Trail. 
It‚Äôs a gorgeous walk to waterfalls, through massive trees, greenery and of course and incredible bamboo forest. We didn‚Äôt expect it to be quite so huge! 
If you travel to Maui, be sure to rent a car for the drive to Hana. 
Leave first thing in the morning and b-line it to the National Park to beat the crowds. You can then take your time coming back avoiding the traffic that comes in later. 
Leave a comment to let us know a hidden gem that you found while on vacation. 
We‚Äôd love to learn about new places to visit from you!

Looking straight into the eyes of the king of the Savannah in Tanzania.
‚Äî‚Äî
It is that time of the year that we count down our favourite images of the year.
This one makes the list because it was one of the best moments that we had when we were on Safari in Tanzania.
We followed 3 males for 2 hours but it was when one walked right at us and came so close we could have reached out and touched him, that I caught my breath.
What an incredible experience.

This shot is the inspiration for today‚Äôs question. 
What is you favourite animal encounter? 
Have you seen a lion in the wild?

Feel free to leave a comment and discuss your experiences with your fellow travellers.

Shot with my @sonyalpha A7RII and my Tamron 150-600mm.

#bealpha #sonyalpha

The magical Tiger's Nest Monastery in Bhutan.
----
It had been one of my dream locations to photograph for years. After seeing it for the first time in a magazine I knew I had to journey to Bhutan to trek up to this mythical place.

This place is the inspiration for today‚Äôs question.
Was there ever a place you saw in a magazine, newspaper or online that inspired you to travel to the destination? 
Did it live up to the expectations? 
Where do you look for inspiration today?

We want to foster more of a conversation here so feel free to leave a comment and discuss your experiences with other travellers. We can learn a lot from each other. -----
Shot with my @sonyalpha A7RII with a Zeiss 24-70.
----- #bealpha #sonyalpha

There is beauty everywhere you look on the Amalfi Coast in Italy.
‚Äî‚Äî
Driving the Amalfi Coast is something everyone should do in their life. The scenery is just breathtaking no matter which direction you look.
‚Äî-
This shot was taken looking North from Ravello. The coastline is dotted with beautiful little towns just like you see here.
‚Äî‚Äî
It is no wonder this part of Italy is so popular. I would recommend that you visit during the shoulder seasons as it can get pretty crazy in the height of summer.
‚Äî‚Äî
Shot on my @djimavicpro ‚Äî‚Äî
#italy #djimavicpro #amalficoast #amalfi #dronephotography #dronestagram

Sunrise at Fairytale Canyon in Kyrgyzstan.
‚Äî-
Located on the southern shore of Lake Issyk-Kul is where you will find Skazka Canyon.
We got up early to catch the sunrise here and man was it worth it.
We flew the drone for some overhead shots but this one that I took in my way back is definitely one of my favourites.
If you get a chance to visit Kyrgyzstan make sure you do it!
It is a country filled with beautiful places like this!
‚Äî‚Äî
Sony A7RII
Zeiss 16-35 f/4
F/22
1/100 sec.
‚Äî‚Äî
#discoverkyrgyzstan #kyrgyzstan #myalpha #sonyalpha

Hiking in the Scottish Highlands!
‚Äî-
One of the best things about doing the North Coast 500 was the number of hikes. 
There are too many to count and they all go through some amazing scenery.
‚Äî-
On this day we were on our way to Applecross and stopped on the side of the road when the sky got really dramatic.
Walking along this path we strolled hiked for about an hour.
That is one thing I love about traveling with no set schedule. You have time to explore.
‚Äî-
What is your favourite hike in he world?
‚Äî‚Äî
#scotland #scotlandhighlands #visitbritain #hiking #nc500

The mighty Kegon Falls in Nikko Japan.
‚Äî‚Äî
I really wanted to see this waterfall in the fall. The colours just really popped.
It stands at almost 100m tall and flows out of Lake Chuzenji.
It is also ranked as one of Japan‚Äôs three most beautiful waterfalls!
‚Äî-
You can take an elevator down to 2 different viewing platforms which allows you to get the best views of this beautiful waterfall.
‚Äî-
This was one of the highlights of our trip to Nikko with @tobu_japan_trip.
You have to visit this once in your life!
‚Äî-
#japan #nikko #nikkojapan #kegonfalls #lakechuzenji #tobujapantrip

The bridge to paradise at Pyramid Lake outside of Jasper, Alberta.
‚Äî‚Äî
Sunrise is the time to photograph this spot. Not only do you have it all to yourself but the light is just spectacular.
I love the way the bridge leads the eye. 
When you have the perfect conditions in Jasper it almost difficult to take a bad shot üòä.
‚Äî‚Äî
Sony A7RII 
16mm
F/11
25 seconds
10 stop ND
‚Äî‚Äî
#myjasper #venturebeyond #explorecanada #travelalberta

A Canadian scene unfolds in front of us just outside of Jasper, Alberta
‚Äî‚Äî
As we were returning from our sunrise shoot at Pyramid Lake this scene caught my eye as we were driving past.
The lake was like glass and there was this lone canoe just off shore.
I remember turning to Deb and saying ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt this just the perfect Canadian moment?‚Äù
‚Äî‚Äî
That is the thing about driving around this area of Alberta. Beauty is around every corner.
‚Äî‚Äî
Sony A7RII
Sony 24-70 f/4
F/11
1/100 sec
‚Äî‚Äî
#myjasper #venturebeyond #travelalberta #explorecanada

The sun sets over the Tokyo Skytree in Japan.
‚Äî‚Äî

Sunset is stunning at Hopewell Rocks, New Brunswick.

Night falls on The Golden Temple of Amritsar in India.
‚Äî-
Visiting The Golesn Temple was at the top of my list in India. Let me tell you it did not disappoint. 
Located in the state of Punjab this is the holiest religious complex in the Sikh religion. 
It is free to enter and they will even feed you for your efforts of coming to visit.
Actually, The Golden Temple feeds up to 100,000 people a day from the free kitchen run by volunteers.
Not only was this a beautiful piece of architecture, but the spirituality that runs through the halls is contagious. 
This is one place you have to visit if you head to India.

When night falls on the ruins of Petra, Jordan.
‚Äî-
The ruins of Petra are amazing to see at any time of the day. But it is when nigh falls and they light the path to Treasury by paper lanterns that it really comes alive.

‚Äî-
My recommendation is to be the last to leave after the show. I lagged behind with my Tripod and shot until the staff took away the lanterns. That way you really have it all to yourself.

Calm before the Storm in the Peruvian Amazon ‚Äî-
Medical emergencies can happen anytime, anywhere and during our trip down the Peruvian Amazon, I broke my back by slipping on a set of steel stairs.¬†
This photo was taken the day before the accident and is a stark reminder of just how quickly a dream vacation can turn into a nightmare.¬†
I was hospitalized for 8 days in a jungle hospital before being airlifted out of the Amazon and home to safety. Luckily I had medical evacuation insurance. If I didn't, I would be out of pocket $75k -$100k paying that back for the rest of my life. I most likely wouldn't have healed as quickly as I did.¬†
We've partnered with @medjetassist to reinforce the importance of medical transport coverage. A Medjet membership means¬†medical transfers from the hospital you are in to your home hospital,¬†regardless of medical necessity. It lets you decide¬†what facility you want to be moved to and it covers both business and personal travel. Find out more in the link in our bio.¬†
And let us know, do you travel with insurance and medical evacuation coverage?

Another perfect beach day in Toronto

Sugar Beach is the perfect place to take in the summer weather in Toronto. 
2018 is the year of health and fitness for The Planet D both at home and on the road. 
One thing that has always been a challenge for us it finding healthy snacks and drinks that we can bring with us when we travel. 
Recently we have discovered Montmorency tart cherries. You can mix some of the tart cherry concentrate with water for a refreshing drink and an added burst of energy.

That makes it the ultimate travel drink to help us fight jet lag and body aches after a long flight! 
This will be our goto drink on the road from now on. ----

‚Äî‚Äî
Hiking in the Himalayas is not just all about the views. Yes, they are spectacular, but it is the people that you meet along the way that stay with you forever.
As we were starting our final climb up to Laya Deb and I hung behind to take some more photos.
As we were walking along the trail this lady motioned for us to come closer. She couldn‚Äôt speak any English and could just motion with her hands. 
We broke out some snacks and shared them with her in silence.
All the while I couldn‚Äôt help but think what change this woman had seen in her life.
After about 20 minutes we had to move on but when we made our way back down she stopped us and shook our hands and thanked us.
It is special moments like these that made trekking in Bhutan so amazing.
‚Äî‚Äî-
#bhutan #bhutanese #bhutan_ig

Taking in the beauty of my ancestral homeland of Scotland. ---- One of the best things we have done was our #AncestryDNA test with @ancestry (#ad). It helped us unlock a whole new dimension to our travels. ‚Äî‚Äî
Being able to trace the roots of my ancestors while I was in Scotland not only made me feel closer to the people but gave me a new appreciation for what my ancestors went through working this rugged land.

Nowhere in the world is this more true then in Antarctica. Being surrounded by immense ice formations and the deafening silence that is only broken by the cracking and creaking of ice is something everyone should experience at least once in their life.
Antarctica is my favourite destination for many reasons but think that feeling of appreciating nature has never been so prevalent then when I was down there.
